title: Small altar of Zeus Soter Hieron
support:
A small horned altar of limestone, damaged across the top
                                        from front to back between the horns. The altar has
                                        mouldings around the base and the top on all four sides,
                                        with a smooth field in between on all four faces

layout.p:
Two lines of Greek text in the field on the front face of the
                                        altar (8.5 cm wide x 2.5 cm high)

handNote.lettering:
The first three letters are more deeply engraved, the remaining
                                    letters are little more than scratched in the surface with a
                                    sharp point, and are increasingly irregular in form. Omega is
                                    open; top and bottom bars of sigma tending slightly apart;
                                    omicron is small than other letters; epsilon has horizontals of
                                    equal length.

provenanceFound._:
Found in excavation in
                            Giardino Spagna (1948), area of the modern Umberto I hospital, Siracusa

facsimile.desc:
Photo J. Prag, Aut. Assessorato Beni Culturali Regione Siciliana n.10681 del
                    06/05/2014

keywords: small altar of zeus soter hieron
